result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina M Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with Legendary Whitetails.
Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased, sold or consumed. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tina M Schmidt

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Theft pursuant to sec. 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1 as amended.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Ct. 1 as amended.  Statements by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Hearing on June 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
